all_numeric_objectives.description: If true, appends all numeric fields to objective_fields.

address.description: For MSG callbacks, the mailbox address to use

delay.description: Seed for an initial random delay before first call, in millisecs.  The actual delay is this value plus a random number in [0, 1000)

fire_once.description: A flag specifying whether callbacks should be called at most once, even if the job is requeued and retraces previous states

order.description: Trigger ordering.  Smaller (or nil) orders are triggered first, with progress callbacks taking preference over state callbacks.  Synchronous and asynchronous callbacks are ordered independently.  Callbacks with the same order, states and synchronicity are triggered in the order they are received.

payload.description: The payload to be used as a message body

progress_variation.description: A number in (0, 1) which gives the variation in progress that will trigger this callback.

register-address.description: For MSG callbacks, whether to register the requested address if it does not yet exist (i.e., whether to create the associated message queue when the mailbox is RabbitMQ)

retries.description: Number of times the callback is retried on failures

retry_delay.description: Seed for a exponential back-off between retries, in millisecs

states.description: A list of states for which the callback should be called. If not given, the callback will be called for either the given progress variation or, if that's not provided, for all state changes

synchronous.description: A flag specifying wether the callback is synchronous and we need to wait for a remote response before proceeding

timeout.description: Lapse in millisecs waiting for the callback to get a response

url.description: The URL to invoke with the method above

dataset_id.description: Identifier of this model's main dataset

dataset_ids.description: Identifiers of this model's additional datasets

default_numeric_value.description: Catch-all missing filler for numeric fields.

default_values.description: A map for field identifiers to values for missing entries.

pretty.description: Whether edge boundaries are rounded values

trim.description: Proportion of data to trim from outer edges of distribution

type.description: Discretize into bins of equal width or population

discretization.description: Parameters to control the discetization of numeric fields

excluded_input_fields.description: List of field identifiers, names or columns to exclude from input

excluded_input_fields_regexps.description: List of regular expressions, excluding input fields  by name

auto_generated.description: True if the field was generated from another field

child_ids.description: IDs of the children if this generates other fields

datatype.description: The storage type of the field

description.description: Free text description of the field

label.description: A label for the field (free text for use by clients)

parent_ids.description: IDs of the parents if this is a generated field

preferred.description: Whether the field is used by default for model creation

bins.description: Captures the distribution for the field.  Each tuple represents a bin from an approximate histogram.  Each bin contains the bin mean and a membership count.  Used when there are more than 32 unique numeric values

counts.description: Captures the distribution for the field.  Contains tuples of the unique values and their occurrence counts. Used when there are 32 or less unique numeric values

kurtosis.description: The sample kurtosis for numeric fields

mean.description: The sample mean for numeric fields

median.description: The approximate median for numeric fields

population.description: # of instances containing data for this field

skewness.description: The sample skewness for numeric fields

standard_deviation.description: The sample standard deviation for numeric fields

sum_squares.description: Sum of squared values (for variance calculation)

variance.description: The sample variance for numeric fields

bin_end.description: The inclusive upper bound of this bin.

bin_start.description: The exclusive lower bound of this bin.

complement.description: Whether this item is a complement

count.description: The number of dataset instances where this item occurs

field_id.description: ID of field that contains this item

name.description: For categorical, items, and text fields: the categorical  value or tag corresponding to this item. For numeric fields:  a name describing a discretization bin.

items.description: Collection of items found in dataset

kind.description: The kind of this message's body

max_k.description: Maximum number of rules to find.

max_lhs.description: Maximum number of items on left-hand side of rules

missing_items.description: Include items for missing field values.

missing_tokens.description: Default tokens that represent a missing value

rhs.description: Item indices in the rule consequent

runtime_limit.description: Rule search time limit in seconds.

out_of_bag.description: Is the sampling out of bag?

rate.description: The rate: fraction of rows we pick

replace.description: Whether we sample with replacement or not

seed.description: A string to feed the random number generator used for sampling.  The same seed produces always the same sample (if all other parameters stay the same).  If not specified, we choose a seed at random

out_of_bag.description: Is the sampling out of bag?

rate.description: The rate: fraction of rows we pick

replace.description: Whether we sample with replacement or not

seed.description: A string to feed the random number generator used for sampling.  The same seed produces always the same sample (if all other parameters stay the same).  If not specified, we choose a seed at random

samples.description: A list of sample specifications, as pairs dataset id and sample

area_under_pr_curve.description: Area under the precision/recall curve for this class

area_under_roc_curve.description: Area under the ROC curve for this class

ks_statistic.description: The max value for phi at any threshold for this class

max_phi.description: The max value for phi at any threshold for this class

present_in_test_data.description: Whether or not this class was seen in the test data for the evaluation

type.description: Identifier of this model's type (e.g., regression)
